inventory.commentary: 11Jun08 - split sense 2 into sense 2 and sense 6, added features. examples ahouston

sense.name: measure of usefulness, desirability
sense.commentary: VALUE[+quality][+usefulness][+desirability] The quality that renders something desirable or useful or important
sense.examples: His knowledge of systems engineering will be of great value to this project. George makes rude comments for shock value. There is no value in getting to the airport three hours early. These shoppers are looking for value but don't want to pay premium prices.

sense.name: price or financial worth of something
sense.examples: Homes have lost 10 percent of their value in the past year. The land increased in value as the urban center expanded. What is the value of their company's stock today?

sense.name: moral principal
sense.commentary: VALUE[+information][+principles][+social][+ethical] An ideal accepted by some individual or group
sense.examples: He has old fashioned values. The candidates all claim to endorse family values. Personal liberty is a fundamental value of democracies.

sense.name: duration of a musical note
sense.commentary: VALUE[+quantity][+duration][+auditory][+note][+musical] The relative duration of a musical note, time value, note value
sense.examples: A dotted eighth note has a greater time value than a simple eighth note. Triplets take up the same space as two notes of that value.

sense.name: relative darkness of a color
sense.commentary: VALUE[+quantity][+measure][+of_darkness][+color] Relative darkness or lightness of a color
sense.examples: I establish the colors and principal values by organizing the painting into three values - dark, medium... and light"- Joe Hing Lowe

sense.name: mathematical magnitude, computed result
sense.examples: The physicist calculated an accurate value for the mass of Jupiter. What is the mean value of x for this set of data points?
